availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Carnahan (Crittenden County, Kentucky, saddler.)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, saddler. Hopkins County, Kentucky native. Son of John Carnahan and Sarah Carnahan. Married Emeline O'Bryan on May 17, 1839. Father of W.B. Carnahan, Electa M. Carnahan. Married to Sarah A. Hammond in Crittenden County, Kentucky on March 11, 1849. Father of William George Carhahan, Emmaline Gordon Carnahan. Saddler in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1850. Employed A.C. Gibbens as saddler in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 214A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 481
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, Marion, p. 316A

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages. (accessed April 16, 2019)
